thread.title: easyJet flight forced to return to Manchester Airport following bird strike
thread.title_full: easyJet flight forced to return to Manchester Airport following bird strike

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: easyJet flight forced to return to Manchester Airport following bird strike
text:
News easyJet flight forced to return to Manchester Airport following bird strike The flight to Berlin Schoenefeld had just taken off from Manchester when a bird was sucked into an engine Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
An easyJet flight was forced to returned to Manchester after a bird was sucked into an engine. 
Flight EZY1897 departed from Manchester Airport for Berlin Schoenefeld at 7.10am on Thursday morning, but returned to the airport shortly afterwards due to a bird strike. 
Fire crews surrounded the flight as it landed as a precaution, but the aircraft landed safely with no problems. 
All passengers were told to leave the flight and have been transferred to a replacement aircraft. 
A spokesman for easyJet said: “easyJet can confirm that flight EZY1897 from Manchester to Berlin Schoenefeld on 2 February 2017 returned to Manchester Airport due to a suspected bird strike. 
“The aircraft landed normally and was met by emergency services on arrival, in line with procedures and as a precaution only. Read More 
“The safety and welfare of our passengers and crew is easyJet’s highest priority. All passengers disembarked normally and have been transferred to a replacement aircraft to continue their journey to Berlin. 
“We would like to apologise for any inconvenience experienced due to the delay.” 
A spokesman for the fire service said: “Four crews from Wythenshawe, Altrincham and Ashton-under-Lyne were called to Manchester Airport at 7.35am, a fire service spokesman confirmed. I 
“It’s understood they were not needed as the plane landed safely.” 
One passenger who was onboard the flight tweeted: “Back at Manchester, plane developed a fault, we are all fine and on the ground. Easyjet captain superb in reassurance.” 
“Chased by fire engines as we came in, engine shut down totally. Scary stuff.”
